content.text:
# 1964 in the Republic of the Congo (Léopoldville)

The following lists events that happened during 1964 in the Republic of the Congo (Léopoldville).
Incumbents
* President: Joseph Kasa-Vubu
* Prime Minister: Cyrille Adoula
Events
{|class=wikitable
!style="width:8em" |Date !!Event
|-
|
| Orientale Province is reconstituted by the rebel government of the short-lived People's Republic of Congo.
|-
|
| Simba rebellion followers of Pierre Mulele make a failed attempt to invade Kamituga.
|-
|  5 June
| Augustin Matata Ponyo, future prime minister of the Democratic Republic of the Congo, is born in Maniema.
|-
| 25 June 25 - 10 July
| Republic of the Congo (Léopoldville) constitutional referendum approved by 91% of voters. The country was renamed the "Democratic Republic of Congo"
|}
See also
* Republic of the Congo (Léopoldville)
* History of the Democratic Republic of the Congo
* Congo Crisis
* 1964 in the Democratic Republic of the Congo
